steps.name: Welcome to Santa Barbara
steps.body:
You will need to do the following in order to set up the General NOAA Operational Modeling Environment for the Santa Barbara Channel :

  1. Set the model run parameters.>Select one of the three possible circulation patterns.
  3. Input the wind conditions.

steps.title: Model Settings
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>

steps.title: Selecting a Circulation Pattern
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
steps.body:
Select a circulation pattern from the menu referring to the pictures below.

!! NOTE !! These three patterns represent 60% of the circulation variability in the area. Select topic button below for more information.

steps.title: Wind Type
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
steps.body:
Wind can significantly influence oil movement and can force oil to move in a different direction from the currents.

You can choose wind that is constant in direction and speed for the entire model run, or you can choose wind that varies in direction and/or speed over time.

steps.title: Considerations
steps.body:
* Nearshore currents

Winds from the WEST can drive nearshore currents that flow towards the EAST along the northern coastline of the Santa Barbara Channel. These nearshore currents are not simulated in this location file.

The circulation patterns in this location file are based on observations from farther offshore.

* The Map

The circulation patterns used in this location file are based on observations. Because data are not available between the Channel Islands, there are some places in the location file where the circulation fields don't exist.
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
